explosives.rationale: It contains chemical groups (nitro group) associated with explosive properties. Since no test results are available, classification is not possible.

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data. (it is reported to be combustible (ICSC).)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: It contains chemical groups (nitro group) associated with explosive properties. Since no test results are available, classification is not possible.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Since its autoignition point is > 400degC (IUCLID, 2007), it does not ignite at room temperature.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_solids.rationale: It is an organic compound containing chlorine and oxygen (but not fluorine), with the chlorine chemically bonded only to carbon or hydrogen, and the oxygen chemically bonded to nitrogen. Since no test results based on standardized testing methods are available, classification is not possible.

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the report that its rat LD50 = 740 mg/kg (IARC, 1983), the substance was classified into Category 4.

acute_toxicity_dermal.hazard_statement: May be harmful in contact with skin
acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the report that its rat LD50 = 5000 mg/kg (IARC, 1983), the substance was classified into Category 5.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: WHO/Pesticide residues in food (1983) reported that the LD50 = 205 mg/L for both female and male rats (the substance was given as 25% emulsion for 1 hour). Since the test was not of a technical product, it was excluded as a reference for classification.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: This substance has been reported to have irritating effects on the skin and eyes of people with occupational exposure (PDS (1996)). Thus, it was classified into Category 2.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: This substance has been reported to have irritating effects on the skin and eyes of people with occupational -exposure (PDS (1996)). Thus, it was classified into Category 2.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: In human exposure studies, patch tests produced positive results (HSDB, 2003). Thus, the substance was classified into Category 1.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Mouse spot tests, a kind of in vivo mutagenicity test using somatic cell, gave negative results (IUCLID, 2000). In addition, rats that received oral administration of the substance did not show chromosomal aberrations in bone marrow cells (IARC 30, 1983). Based on these results, the substance was classified into the "Not classified" category.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: It is rated as "Group 2B" by IARC S7 (1987) and "R" by the U.S. NTP (2005). Based on these ratings, the substance was classified into Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May damage fertility or the unborn child
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In oral and dermal applications of this substance to pregnant rats, malformations such as cardiac malformations, diaphragmatic hernias, and hydronephrosis were noted in pups that were born from exposed mothers at doses that did not show toxic effects in maternal animals (PDS 84 (1996)). In addition, hydrocephalus and microphthalmia were seen in progeny of mice that received oral administration of the substance during gestation (IARC 30 (1983)). Also, oral administration of the substance to pregnant rats was associated with increased fetal deaths and lowered postnatal survival rates. These reports demonstrated that clear cases of reproductive toxicity become apparent at doses that do not show maternal toxicity. Thus, the substance was classified into Category 1B.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: A man exposed to commercial formulation of nitrofen complained of upper respiratory tract irritation (PDS 84, 1996), and acute toxic effects of this substance are mostly on respiratory tracts and the nervous system (IARC 30, 1983). Based on these reports, the substance was classified into Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation). Regarding its effect on the nervous system, details such as the relationship between the effects and doses were not found. Thus, classification was not carried out for the nervous system.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (blood system) May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (nervous system)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: In agricultural workers who experienced excessive exposure to nitrofen, reduction in hemoglobin and leukocyte counts was noted (NTP TR 184, 1979), and chronic occupational exposure without protection resulted in central nervous system disturbances and anemia (HSDB, 2003). Based on these reports, the substance was classified into Category 1 (blood system) and Category 2 (nervous system).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since its 48-hour LC50 for crustaceans (a species of the Ceriodaphnia) is 0.216 mg/L (ECOTOX, 2007), the substance was classified into Category 1 for acute toxicity.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Its classification for acute toxicity is Category 1, it is not rapidly degradable (BIOWIN 2007), and logPow = 4.64 (SRC 2005). Based on this information, the substance was classified into Category 1 for chronic toxicity.
